titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Yale and New Haven Postcard Collection
Yale and New Haven Postcard Collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 09:03

did.unittitle: Yale and New Haven postcard collection

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The materials consist of souvenir postcards of Yale and New Haven, Connecticut. Most of the postcards depict buildings and grounds; some are reproductions of well-known 18th and 19th century views of Yale College and the New Haven Green, such as the Doolittle and Barber views. Also included are postcards depicting Yale athletics, symbols, and student life. Many are photographic scenes taken by Samuel Chamberlain for the American Scene postcard series.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 48-A (YRG 48-A), Yale pictorial records and collections.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Yale and New Haven Postcard Collection (RU 687). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials consist of souvenir postcards of Yale and New Haven, Connecticut. Most of the postcards depict buildings and grounds; some are reproductions of well-known 18th and 19th century views of Yale College and the New Haven Green, such as the Doolittle and Barber views. Also included are postcards depicting Yale athletics, symbols, and student life. Many are photographic scenes taken by Samuel Chamberlain for the American Scene postcard series.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Accession 2016-A-014 was gift of David A. Northrop, 2015.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The number before each entry refers to building code [region:chronology].

odd.head: General
odd.p: Small postcard album published by Midas and Hahn, New Haven, Connecticut.
